pr_title: Mappings relating to code that uses CsvWriter

timeline.message: Mappings relating to code that uses CsvWriter

timeline.bodyText: Is this like the "gui_light": "side" in item model? I feel this name itself isn't very clear and might get some javadocs.
timeline.author: liach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_777 net/minecraft/client/render/model/BakedQuad
+	FIELD field_22441 directionalLighting Z

replies.bodyText:
That's a very good question. I tried to trace where it was coming from, and other parts refer to it as "shade/d" (which I will take responsibility for)
Neither name is idea, so i may look into it a little further to see if I can trace it back to an actual value in the json resources.
replies.author: Sollace
Sollace

replies.bodyText: Perhaps it still needs a javadoc, because shade isn't exactly a clear meaning...
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.bodyText: I'd suggest getDebugMessage or getDumpMessage if this is only used for dumping. getString doesn't sound very informative...
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: In this case the string it returns is describing the contents of the tick manager. So really, it's a bit like a toString method for dumps. toDumpString?
replies.author: Sollace
liach

replies.bodyText: a dumped string, as shown in debug command dump.
replies.author: liach

timeline.bodyText: What does "area" mean here? What's the "horizontal size" and why isn't it determined by start and end positions?
timeline.author: Runemoro
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -38,3 +44,14 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_4525 net/minecraft/test/StructureTestUtil
 		ARG 0 pos
 		ARG 1 radius
 		ARG 2 world
+	METHOD method_22368 (ILnet/minecraft/class_2338;Lnet/minecraft/class_3218;)V
+		ARG 0 altitude
+		ARG 1 pos
+		ARG 2 world
+	METHOD method_22369 createStructure (Ljava/lang/String;Lnet/minecraft/class_3218;)Lnet/minecraft/class_3499;
+		ARG 0 structureId
+		ARG 1 world
+	METHOD method_23646 createArea (Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;I)Lnet/minecraft/class_3341;
+		ARG 0 startPos
+		ARG 1 endPos
+		ARG 2 horizontalSize

replies.bodyText:
The area is a BlockBox used for positioning structures. I've revised the parameters a bit, but basically the values are:
pos = Pos1 of the box. This is the pos parameter passed down from other methods.
size = Width/Height/Depth of the box (passed down as the size of the structure)
margin = Extra margin to expend the area by along the X+Z axis.
The final box's dimensions are calculated as follows:
min = pos - [margin, 3, margin]
max = pos + size + [margin - 1, 30, margin - 1]
replies.author: Sollace
